brief.content-text: The diagram depicts the MAC address used for addressing in Ethernet. PC's A, B, C, D, E, F, and G are attached to shared media (multiple access). All Ethernet nodes share the media. To receive the data sent to it, each node needs a unique address. A frame for PC D is on the wire. PC D says: "Yes, that frame is for me." All other PC's reject the frame.
